alert.note: Alert for Lawrence (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 24 at 3:52AM CST until February 24 at 9:45PM CST by NWS Huntsville
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Alabama... Big Nance Creek at Courtland affecting Lawrence County. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Big Nance Creek at Courtland. * WHEN...Until late this evening. * IMPACTS...At 14.0 feet, Lowland flooding begins on the left bank of the river. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 3:30 AM CST Thursday the stage was 14.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 3:30 AM CST Thursday was 14.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 14.5 feet this morning. It will then fall below flood stage late this afternoon. - Flood stage is 14.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 14.6 feet on 01/18/2006. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
